key_title: Key to the varieties of Calotis scabiosifolia

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Calotis
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Calotis. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Basal leaves c. narrow-oblanceolate, to 1 cm wide, entire or distantly toothed, tapering gradually to petiole which is usually shorter than blade; faces of cypselas villous in central regions; ray florets usually mauve; mainly eastern Victoria

Basal leaves c. obovate to spathulate, mostly 1 cm wide or more (up to c. 4 cm), serrate, biserrate or pinnatifid, usually tapered rather abruptly to petiole which is subequal in length to blade; faces of cypselas glabrous to weakly pubescent in central region; ray florets usually white; north and west of Melbourne
